intro: Pseudopodospermum strictum, commonly known as the rigid pseudopodospermum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It produces capsules as fruits, which contain numerous small, smooth seeds.
